title: SIGSEGV: invalid memory reference, cross-compiling macOS -> aarch64-unknown-none-softfloat when opt-level = 0

labels.name: A-target-feature
labels.description: Area: Enabling/disabling target features like AVX, Neon, etc.

body:
I'm facing a SIGSEGV when cross-compiling from macOS Mojave 10.14.6 to aarch64-unknown-none-softfloat using

rustc 1.56.0-nightly (0035d9dce 2021-08-16)

I need to use nightly because of a couple of features provided only there. 

This happens only when i try to reduce the optimization level to 0 (opt-level = 0)

It **does not happen** when using opt-level = 1

I have included a very small testcase, HTH.

cheers,

Matthias


Here's the output of 'make':


rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.56.0-nightly (0035d9dce 2021-08-16)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 0035d9dcecee49d1f7349932bfa52c05a6f83641
commit-date: 2021-08-16
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.56.0-nightly
LLVM version: 12.0.1
RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo build --target aarch64-unknown-none-softfloat
   Compiling core-hello-world v0.1.0 (/Users/mschmidt/prj/rust/core-hello-world)
error: could not compile `core-hello-world`

Caused by:
  process didn't exit successfully: `rustc --crate-name core_hello_world --edition=2018 src/main.rs --error-format=json --json=diagnostic-rendered-ansi --crate-type bin --emit=dep-info,link -C lto -C debuginfo=2 -C metadata=b4f8e8e22920b704 -C extra-filename=-b4f8e8e22920b704 --out-dir /Users/mschmidt/prj/rust/core-hello-world/target/aarch64-unknown-none-softfloat/debug/deps --target aarch64-unknown-none-softfloat -C incremental=/Users/mschmidt/prj/rust/core-hello-world/target/aarch64-unknown-none-softfloat/debug/incremental -L dependency=/Users/mschmidt/prj/rust/core-hello-world/target/aarch64-unknown-none-softfloat/debug/deps -L dependency=/Users/mschmidt/prj/rust/core-hello-world/target/debug/deps` (signal: 11, SIGSEGV: invalid memory reference)
make: *** [all] Error 101



[core-hello-world.tar.gz](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/files/7287516/core-hello-world.tar.gz)
